translated: It is settled by the application of the three methods of settling disputes: by acknowledgment, by resolution face-to-face, and by covering over as if with grass.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug par 'os pa ni 'khrug long gi rgyu gsum pa ltung ba dang bcas pa rnam par mi shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid las byung ba'i 'khrug long ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa yin

original: mngon sum la sogs pa rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po thams cad kyis 'dul bar 'os pa ni 'khrug long gi rgyu bzhi pa las la mthun pa mi sbyin pa las byung ba'i 'khrug long bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa yin te /

original: de la ni mngon sum gyis 'dul ba la sogs pa rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po thams cad kyis snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par rgyud gcig tu bya ba dang / dag pa sbyin pa dang / phyir bcos pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa la sbyor ba nyid sbyin pa'i rim gyis las la mthun pa sbyin du gzhug pas zhi bar bya ste /

analyzed: des de nyid la bdag gi bya ba tha na 'dag rdzas dang so shing yan chad cung zad kyang spang bar bya'o //
translated: I should not even slightly allow them to do anything for me, not even to the extent of offering me a toothpick or mouth-rinsing water.

original: lhan cig 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / lhan cig 'chags sar 'chag ba dang gtam 'dre ba dang phebs par smra ba yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / lhan cig 'chags sar 'chag ba dang gtam 'dre ba dang phebs par smra ba yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: I should not stand or sit together with them, or walk on a path together with them, or converse with them or greet them.

original: rjes su 'brang na de dag la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag legs bar gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas /üîΩ'thab par gyur mtshang 'dru bar gyur /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang na de dag la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag legs bar gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas / 'thab par gyur mtshang 'dru bar gyur /
translated: If they follow me, I should say to them, ‚ÄòVenerable friends, having gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya,üîΩyou have become quarrelsome, engaged in disputes,

original: rtsod par gyur /üîΩ'gyed par gyur cing gnas pa ni ma rnyed de rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod par gyur / 'gyed par gyur cing gnas pa ni ma rnyed de rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: contentious, and prone to disputation.üîΩThis is not gain but a loss for you,üîΩthis is a misfortune for you, not a good fortune. Venerable friends, do not quarrel, do not become engaged in disputes,

original: nyes pa rnyed kyi legs pa rnyed pa ma yin gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma 'thab shig mtshang ma 'dru shig / ma rtsod cig ma 'gyed cig /'gyed pa gnyi ga rgyal ba med do //
analyzed: nyes pa rnyed kyi legs pa rnyed pa ma yin gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma 'thab shig mtshang ma 'dru shig / ma rtsod cig ma 'gyed cig /'gyed pa gnyi ga rgyal ba med do //
translated: do not become contentious, do not become prone to disputation. In a disputation there is no victory for either party.‚Äô

original: rgyug pas gnyi ga mgyogs pa med de gcig rgyal gcig 'bam du 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyug pas gnyi ga mgyogs pa med de gcig rgyal gcig 'bam du 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If they run, they are both equally fast, and one will be the winner and the other the loser.üîΩThe dispute is settled by the first method, the face-to-face meeting, when the two parties are of equal strength, because they are incited to quarrel by the wrong practice of the reality of the subject matter of the Dharma and Vinaya.üîΩThe dispute is settled by the second method, the majority decision, when the two parties are of equal strength, because they are incited to quarrel by the wrong practice of the reality of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de tsam gyis chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par bsgrubs pa las byung pa'i 'khrug long 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa mngon sum gyis 'dul bas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi bar 'gyur ba 'gyed pa gnyis rang gis mi nus na tshogsüîΩpar dbyung ba dag gis legs par bsgrubs pas zhi bar bya ba ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par bsgrubs pa las byung pa'i 'khrug long 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa mngon sum gyis 'dul bas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi bar 'gyur ba 'gyed pa gnyis rang gis mi nus na tshogs par dbyung ba dag gis legs par bsgrubs pas zhi bar bya ba ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The dispute is settled by the third method, the method of the covering over as if with grass, when the two parties are of equal strength, because they are incited to quarrel by the wrong practice of the reality of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: re zhig de ltar na 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa mngon sum gyis 'dul bas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa mngon sum gyis 'dul bas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi ba yin no //
translated: The dispute is settled by the fourth method, the method of the decision of the majority, when the two parties are of equal strength, because they are incited to quarrel by the wrong practice of the reality of the Dharma and Vinaya.üîΩThe dispute is settled by the fifth method, the method of the decision of the one who is skilled in the Vinaya, when the two parties are of equal strength, because they are incited to quarrel by the wrong practice of the reality of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: da ni chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa nyi tshe'i dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i 'khrug long 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa @111a * //
analyzed: da ni chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa nyi tshe'i dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i 'khrug long 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa @111a * //
translated: Now, in order to settle disputes that arise from wrongly establishing the reality of limited objects of knowledge, the treatise is composed in order to pacify disputes through the other method of establishing the correct position, by giving many sticks to the disputants and making them agree on one position.

original: tshul shing mang po sbyin pas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi bar 'gyur ba ches mang ba'i blos rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba legs par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis zhi bar bya pa bshad par bya ste 'di ni chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa
analyzed: tshul shing mang po sbyin pas rgyud gcig tu bya bas zhi bar 'gyur ba ches mang ba'i blos rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba legs par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis zhi bar bya pa bshad par bya ste 'di ni chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa
translated: This is the chapter on the establishment of the aggregates.

original: la srid kyi tshul khrims rnam par gtan la dbab pa la ni mi srid de /
analyzed: la srid kyi tshul khrims rnam par gtan la dbab pa la ni mi srid de /
translated: This is not possible in the establishment of ethics,

original: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'gyed pa gnyis rang gis mi nus na tshogs bar dbyung ba dag gis legs par bsgrubs pas zhi bar ma nus pa nyid yin zhing rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis rtsod pa de gces par gzung ba nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'gyed pa gnyis rang gis mi nus na tshogs bar dbyung ba dag gis legs par bsgrubs pas zhi bar ma nus pa nyid yin zhing rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis rtsod pa de gces par gzung ba nyid dang /
translated: If the two parties are unable to resolve the dispute themselves, they should be reconciled by a group of monks.üîΩIf they are still unable to resolve the dispute, the elders should relate the past events of the dispute and the parties should be made to feel ashamed.üîΩIf the dispute is still not resolved, the four members of the sa·πÖgha should draw lots to determine the order in which the parties will speak.

original: rab tu dam pa nyid dang mi bzad pa nyid dang / bsdams par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i don dang gnas brtan mthu dang ldan pa la sngar byung ba brjod de dus thug ba med bar dbul ba'i mthar thug pa dag yongs su nyon mongs par gyur pa nyid yin na de la dge 'dun bzhi bos tshul shingüîΩ'dri ma pa'i dge slong bskos te /

translated: If the dispute is still not resolved, the sa·πÖgha should appoint a monk who is free of faults to be the arbitrator.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing mang po bris zhing gang mang ba'i phyogs la skyo sdogs mi bya ba des gdul bar bos pa la tshul shing mang po sbyin bas rgyud gcig tu bya bas rtsod pa de zhi bar bya ba yin no //

translated: The method of settling disputes is to write down the Dharma and non-Dharma on many sticks, and then to settle the dispute by making the assembly hold many sticks, without regard for which side is more numerous.

original: de'i go rims rnam par gzhag ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i go rims rnam par gzhag ba ni 'di yin te /

translated: The order of the procedure for the Sa·πÖgha to appoint a stick-distributor, the teaching of the rules for the distributor of the sticks, the teaching of the rules for the receiver of the sticks, and the settling of the dispute by making the assembly hold many sticks, without regard for which side is more numerous, by means of another method of establishing the mind in what is most numerous.

analyzed: dge 'dun bzhi pos rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba ni phyogs su rnam par gnas pa gnyi gar spyir blo mthun par bya ste /

analyzed: dge 'dun gyis je dang por spro bar bya zhing gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko ba'i cho ga dang las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The procedure and the rite for appointing him through a proposal and a single proclamation by the Sa·πÖgha is as follows:

analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams @111b la yang dag par bsgo nas /

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge 'dun la tshul shing 'dri ma pa spro'am /
translated: Are you, [name], able to distribute the voting tickets to the sa·πÖgha?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI am able.‚Äù

translated: This monk, [name], is able to distribute the voting tickets to the sa·πÖgha.üîΩIf the time is right and the sa·πÖgha can bear it, I ask the sa·πÖgha to agree to appoint the monk [name] as the distributor of the voting tickets.

analyzed: dge 'dun btsun ba rnams gsan du gsol / dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la tshul shing 'dri ma par spro ste /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable sa·πÖgha, please listen!üîΩThis monk, [name], is able to distribute the voting tickets to the sa·πÖgha.

analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyi sa ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di tshul shing 'dri ma bar bsko na /
translated: For that reason, if the sa·πÖgha appoints the monk [name] as the distributor of the voting tickets,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di tshul shing 'dre ma par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de ngag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun
translated: Those who do not agree should speak.

analyzed: gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di tshul shing 'dri ma par bskos lags te /

translated: Having covered the non-dharma ballots and revealed the dharma ballots, he should say to the Sa·πÖgha: ‚ÄòVenerable Sirs, these dharma ballots are straight,

original: khya khyor med pa /
analyzed: khya khyor med pa /

analyzed: 'chas 'chus med pa dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / dri zhim pa dang / reg na 'jam pa dag yin gyis long shig ces brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: chos kyi tshul shing blangs pa dag gis slob ma la sogs pa dag chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing len par rtsol ba lta na de dag la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / mkhan po gcig pa dang /
translated: If those who have taken the Dharma stick should try to make their disciples and so on take the non-Dharma stick, they should be told, ‚ÄúVenerable, you should not make your disciples and so on take the non-Dharma stick.üîΩ

analyzed: slob dpon gcig pa dang / gtam 'dre ba dang / phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin dang / 'grogs bshes dag gis chos kyi tshul shing blangs kyis khyod gyis kyang chos kyi tshul shing long shig / khyod de dag dang lhan cig rtsod par gyur na ma legs so zhes rna drung du bshub po //
translated: If those who have taken the Dharma faction should try to get their students and so on to take the non-Dharma faction, they should be told, ‚ÄúVenerable, your preceptors, teachers, co-preceptors, co-teachers, conversation partners, those with whom you converse, those with whom you are familiar, and your friends have taken the Dharma faction. original: de'i 'og tu tshul shing len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos bstan pa'i go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul shing len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos bstan pa'i go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /

analyzed: dge slong tshul shing len pa dag gis chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing blang bar mi bya'o //

original: de yang mngon sum gyis 'dul ba dang / tshul shing mang po sbyin pas rgyud gcig tu bya bas las la mthun pa sbyin du gzhug pa dang / dran pas 'dul ba dang / ma smyos pas 'dul bas dag pa sbyin pas las la mthun pa sbyin du gzhug pas zhi bar 'gyur te /

translated: Similarly, a dispute arises due to the cause of rejecting others by positing instructions and so on, but it is pacified by giving concordant actions through the training of directly perceiving the dispute, by giving many voting sticks to unify the mindstream, by the training of mindfulness and by the training of not being insane.

original: de ltar na rgyu gang gis mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa kun nas slong zhing chos gang dag gis thabs ji ltar bya bas de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de nyid kyis bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa yang kun nas slong zhing chos de dag dang /üîΩthabs de nyid kyis las la mthun pa sbyin du gzhug pas de zhi @124a * //

translated: Thus, one should engage in pacifying disputes by the very causes that do not instruct, because one engages in activity for the sake of those causes by which disputes are instigated and pacified through the methods of those Dharmas.

analyzed: las la mthun pa sbyin du 'jug pas zhi bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: chos de dag dang / thabs de nyid kyis las la mthun pa sbyin du gzhug pas /
